content.p: We are no longer accepting Clearing applications for 2024 entry. Clearing is a UCAS application process available during July and August each year for applicants not holding any UCAS offers, or who change their mind after standard UCAS applications close. Information on Clearing 2025 vacancies at Nottingham and how to prepare for Clearing will be available here closer to the time. Search our 2025 entry courses now. We are currently accepting standard UCAS applications for these and not all courses will be available in Clearing. Confused about Clearing? Read our quick guide Guidance for parents, families and professionals The Clearing process through UCAS Clearing can be stressful, and there are a lot of misconceptions about Clearing and what it means to apply through Clearing. We're busting all the myths about Clearing to reassure you it's nothing to worry about. Explore our campuses online Find out why Explore our University Park Campus University Park is the University of Nottingham’s largest campus at 300 acres. Part of the university since 1929, the campus is widely regarded as one of the largest and most attractive in the country Scholarships and bursaries For students who are seeking or have been granted asylum in the UK. For students showing strong academic ability who have overcome significant obstacles to their academic progression For students who live and/or attended school in Nottinghamshire, Derbyshire or the wider East Midlands area Faculty of Science The Alumni Scholarships provide financial support to eligible students taking an undergraduate degree in the Faculty of Science. If you’re looking for more information, please head to our help and support hub, where you can find frequently asked questions or details of how to make an enquiry.
